FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS – RELEASE OF INFORMATION
HOW TO OBTAIN COPIES OF MY MEDICAL RECORDS?
Question

Response

How do I obtain copies of my medical
records?
Where is the form?

Patients or their representatives complete and submit an Authorization to
Release Protected Health Information (PHI).
The authorization form should be completed using the MyChart portal or
through the vendor portal. This is the preferred method. Note: You will
need 2 forms of picture identification available to scan into the portal when
using the Verisma portal.
The hospital can assist you with creating this account.
As a last option the paper form can be submitted. You will need to be sure
to legibly complete each field on the form.

What if I do not have a MyChart account?
Can I still do the paper form?

Where do I send the completed form if in
paper?
How will I receive copies of my medical
records?

What information is available on MyChart
(formerly myNYP.org)?

Are there any exceptions to having
information sent to MyChart or the portal?

The form is available on the NYP website at www.nyp.org/HIM in English,
Spanish and Chinese
On the NYP website is a listing of all addresses and contact numbers to call
regarding copies of medical records from each location of NYP.
On the Authorization form you will select your preferred method of
receiving the information such as CD/DVD, electronically to the portal, etc.
For ongoing care, we recommend having the information uploaded to
MyChart so the information is available when you need it.
Currently:
Cardiology Reports (EKG, Echocardiogram)
Discharge/Visit Reports: Discharge Instructions, Discharge Medications,
Discharge Summary
Lab Tests (excluding HIV, STD, STI, Microbiology)
Radiology Reports (CT Scan, MRI, Ultrasound, Nuclear Medicine, X-Ray)
Operative Reports
Other Reports (Care Plan, Care Team, Immunizations, Medication Allergies,
Medications, Problems, Procedure Codes, Smoking Status, Vital Signs)
Yes. At this time, Behavioral Health information is not available on the
portal.

 Question

Response

Can parents request copies of the medical
record for their minor child?

Parents for patients under the age of 12 may request the medical records
for their child.
Parents of minors between the age of 12 and 18 must have the minor child
sign the Authorization Form.
Exception: if for ongoing medical care/treatment the parents of adolescents
may sign the authorization for medical records to be sent directly to the
next provider.
The Authorization must be signed by the next of kin per the hierarchy for
the executor of the estate or distributee.

How do I get copies of the medical records
for family member who has expired?
How do I get copies of my radiology films
and pathology slides?
How do I get copies of my medical records
from the physician offices?
Is there a number I can call if I need help
with completing the form or to check on a
request I submitted?

The additional information/contact sheet on the website provides the
contact information for these items.
Using the same Authorization form, send the form to the mailing address on
the Additional Information Sheet for the Physician Practices.
Yes. For NYP Hospital records you may call 646-NYP-4ROI (646-697-4764).
This number is available Monday through Friday from 8am to 6pm.
